alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 8:28PM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Tampico affecting Valley County. .Warm temperatures will melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Malta, Dodson, Glasgow, Nashua...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Milk River at Tampico. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 25.5 feet, County gravel roads north of the Milk River become impassable. At 28.5 feet, Power substation between the Milk River and Tampico Road will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 27.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM MDT Thursday was 27.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 27.8 feet early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.9 feet on 06/10/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning by 1100 AM MDT.
